alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 4:51AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 645 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Creek and small stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall. This will cause small stream flooding or elevated flows in the area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... west and north of Mammoth, south and east of Dudleyville and Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding or elevated flows are occurring or imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
